From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Appendix:Variations of "salat"

English

[edit]
English Wikipedia has an article on:
Salat
Wikipedia

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from French Salat.

Proper noun

[edit]

Salat

  1. A right tributary of the Garonne in Occitania, France.

Related terms

[edit]
  • Mazères-sur-Salat
  • Salies-du-Salat

French

[edit]
French Wikipedia has an article on:
Salat
Wikipedia fr

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Occitan Salat, from salat (“salty”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /sa.lat/

Proper noun

[edit]

le Salat m

  1. Salat (a right tributary of the Garonne in Occitania, France)
    Holonym: Occitanie

Related terms

[edit]
  • La Bastide-du-Salat
  • Mazères-sur-Salat
  • Salies-du-Salat

Descendants

[edit]
  • → English: Salat

See also

[edit]

(tributaries):

  • Alet
  • Arbas
  • Baup
  • Lez
  • Marcazeau
  • Merdançon
  • ruisseau de Montredon

German

[edit]

Etymology 1

[edit]

15th century, from earlier Italian salata, a variant of insalata, likely reinforced by Middle French salade.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /zaˈlaːt/ (Germany)
    • Audio:(file)(Germany)
    • Audio:(file)(Germany)
  • IPA(key): /saˈlaːt/ (Austria, Southern Germany, Switzerland)
  • Rhymes: -aːt
  • Hyphenation: Sa‧lat

Noun

[edit]

Salat m (strong, genitive Salats or Salates, plural Salate, diminutive Salätchen n)

  1. salad (mixed, usually cold dish)
  2. lettuce and related leaf vegetables
    Synonym: Lattich
Declension
[edit]
Declension of Salat [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Salat die Salate
genitive eines des Salats, Salates der Salate
dative einem dem Salat, Salate1 den Salaten
accusative einen den Salat die Salate

1Now rare, see notes.

Derived terms
[edit]
  • salatartig

Etymology 2

[edit]

From Arabic صَلَاة (ṣalāh).

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Salah

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /saˈlaːt/

Noun

[edit]

Salat f or n (strong, genitive Salat or (neuter only) Salats, plural Salats or Salawat)

  1. (religion, Islam) obligatory prayer, salat
    Synonym: (islamisches) Pflichtgebet
Declension
[edit]
Declension of Salat [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Salat die Salats, Salawat
genitive einer der Salat der Salats, Salawat
dative einer der Salat den Salats, Salawat
accusative eine die Salat die Salats, Salawat
Declension of Salat [neuter, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein das Salat die Salats, Salawat
genitive eines des Salat, Salats der Salats, Salawat
dative einem dem Salat den Salats, Salawat
accusative ein das Salat die Salats, Salawat

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Salat” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
  • “Salat” in Uni Leipzig: Wortschatz-Lexikon

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

(This etymology is missing or incomplete. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.)

Proper noun

[edit]

Salat m

  1. Salat (a right tributary of the Garonne in Occitania, France)
    Holonym: Occitània

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Maseras de Salat
  • Salias de Salat

Descendants

[edit]
